article.headline: Wofford 85, NC Greensboro 82
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Eric Marshall had five of his 14 points in overtime and Wofford rallied to beat North Carolina Greensboro 85-82 at the Southern Conference tournament on Wednesday night. A driving basket by Byron Fields with 1.1 seconds left in regulation at 68-all. Then Marshall had a tip in to give the Terriers (9-19) the lead for good. They were up 77-70 in the extra period with less than 90 seconds to go. But the Spartans, who lost in triple overtime to Elon this past Saturday, cut the margin to 84-82 on Ronnie Taylor's 3-pointer with 14.1 seconds left. Marshall made one of two foul shots and North Carolina Greensboro (11-17) had one more chance to tie. Taylor took a 23-foot shot with two defenders on him and it fell short with .05 seconds remaining. Wofford made it past the first round for the third time in the past five tournaments. The Terriers face Georgia Southern in Thursday's quarterfinals. North Carolina Greensboro looked like it had the game in hand when Taylor's basket made it 68-63 with 1:17 left. However Howard Wilkinson had his third 3-pointer -- and Wofford's eighth of the second half after going 0-12 from behind the arc the first 20 minutes -- and Fields his game-tying drive. Wilkerson finished with 18 points and Fields a career high 17. Jay Joseph led the Spartans with 21 points, 10 rebounds and four assists. He also had seven of the team's 22 turnovers. Since winning the conference tournament and going to the NCAA tournament in 2001, North Carolina Greensboro has gone 1-3 in the postseason.
